data.title: RATP Dev USA
data.meta_description: RATP Dev USA | 8,259 followers on LinkedIn. Your future. Our destination. | RATP Dev is a subsidiary of RATP Group established in 2002 to export the Group's operating and maintenance know how outside the historic transit network operated by RATP in the Paris region of France. RATP Dev now operates in 13 countries on four continents. In 2015, RATP Dev generated revenue exceeding 1.1B euros.
data.text:
Mentors are an essential part of a leadership development program's success and RATP Dev USA has some of the best mentors. We would like to extend our heartfelt appreciation to the mentors who have invested their valuable time and expertise to support their mentees throughout our inaugural Leadership Development and Mentoring class. Their dedication and commitment over the course of 9 months are commendable and has contributed significantly to shaping the success of current and future leaders at RATP Dev USA. We are indeed fortunate to have a strong mentoring group that embodies our core values. Thank You Mentors! Donna Zampella Lenny Cooksey Serena Stevenson, TSSP, PTSCTP Shane Bollar Steve Spade #ratpdevusa #ratpdev #leadership #mentoring #transit #transportation

Join the fireside chat to learn how Stacy has taken on the heavy task of connecting her company‚Äôs 4,000 frontline workers through a centralized super-app, ultimately optimizing employee communications and relations! üóìÔ∏è Date: Tomorrow (August, 8) ‚è∞ Time: 11am ET | 4pm BST Take this opportunity to secure your spot now: https://lnkd.in/dwbiPAgq #webinar #RATPDevUSA #employeeengagement #culture #workplace

TUCSON CELEBRATES FEDERAL BUS GRANT - Tucson Mayor Regina Romero and other City officials attended an event this morning, July 10, to celebrate a recent $11.38 million bus grant from the Federal Transit Administration (FTA). FTA Region 9 Administrator Ray Tellis was also on hand to discuss the planned work, made possible with funding from the Biden administration's Bipartisan Infrastructure Law and the work of Arizona's congressional delegation. ‚ÄúThe City of Tucson is thrilled to have earned this $11.3 million grant from the Federal Transit Administration to replace aging bus lifts, install 80 bus shelters, and update signs and add accessibility elements at more than 500 bus stops throughout our community," Romero said. There will be added trees for shade, Braille signage, large print, wayfinding, and audible information to make Sun Tran more accessible and equitable. https://lnkd.in/gDTuBXWJ #Bus #Grant #Community #Celebration #Transportation

The #transportation industry is rich with opportunity. There are countless career paths available ‚Äì from engineering to construction ‚Äì to sales, operations, vehicle maintenance, accounting and more! No matter what your background or where you come from, there is a path for you to make a significant impact in your community by helping move people safely and effectively. Through our NATA network, our members and associates highlight these opportunities and the potential through a career in transportation. One of our board members, Matt Booterbaugh, exemplifies this through his journey coming from outside of the industry and now serving as CEO of RATP Dev USA. Learn more about his story below!
